artciles.q:
Terzaghi's one-dimensional consolidation
            theory assumes that
option: e vs. p relationship is linear
e vs. log p relationship is linear
p vs. log e relationship is linear
e vs log p/p0 relationship is linear
artciles.answer: e vs. log p relationship is linear

artciles.q: The coefficient of consolidation is used for
option: establishing the duration of primary consolidation
estimating the amount of settlement for a load increment
determining the depth to which the soil is stressed when loads are applied on the surface of a soil deposit
determining the preconsolidation pressure for soil deposits known to be over consolidated
artciles.answer: establishing the duration of primary consolidation
artciles.description:
For a given degree of consolidation U, time factor T has a certain value, depending upon the boundary conditions governing the problem. 
            The time required for a soil to reach a given degree of consolidation can be calculated by knowing the length of drainage path and coefficient of consolidation.

artciles.q: The slope of the e-log curve for a soil mass gives

artciles.description: The slow rate of consolidation of saturated clays of low permeability may be accelerated by means of vertical sand drains which provide for radial drainage, resulting in shortening of drainage path. Consolidation is then mainly due to horizontal radial drainage which results in a faster dissipation of excess pore water pressure.
